info.title: IN-FORM API
info.description: This document describes IN-FORM API providing access to the IN-FORM's data. API is build basis on REST architecture. Access to the resources is made by using one of possible request presented below.

tags.name: search
tags.description: Searching in multiple resurces kinds in IN-FORM.

tags.name: timeTracking
tags.description: Access to IN-FORM's time tracking entries API.

tags.name: servicedObjects
tags.description: Access to IN-FORM's serviced objects resources

tags.name: reports
tags.description: Access to IN-FORM's reports and statistics.

post.description:
Used to create a contact entry for an address.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2025.00**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Name of the company in IN-FORM.

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

get.description:
Used to get a list of contact entries for an address.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2025.00**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Name of the company in IN-FORM.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset from the beginning of collection of possible results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of returned addresses.

parameters.name: phrase
parameters.description: Returns data containing the text.

parameters.name: addressKey
parameters.description: Key of the address in IN-FORM to which the contacts are assigned.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Results sorting order.
Suffix .**asc** means ascending order, .**desc** means descending order.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of fields which need to be returned in response.
When **fields** parameter is set to ***all***, then all available data are returned.
When **fields** parameter is empty or is set to ***default***, then request returns:
`key`
`dateTime`
`addressKey`
`status`
`employeeKey`
`mainProject`

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

parameters.description:
Optional checksum used to prevent overwriting changes made to the resource by other users.
In order to use this mechanism, this header needs to be filled with value returned in **eTag** header of getCalendarEvent response.

get.description:
Used to get a list of calendar events occurrences for specified owner. Both standard events and serial events occurrences will be returned.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2024.00**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset from the beginning of collection of possible results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of returned events.

parameters.name: ownerKey
parameters.description: Identification key of the employee that is owner of the events.

parameters.name: endDateTime.gte
parameters.description: Event's end date and time greater than or equal to the given date in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: startDateTime.lte
parameters.description: Event's start date and time less than or equal to the given date in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of fields which need to be returned in response.
When **fields** parameter is set to ***all***, then all available data are returned.
When **fields** parameter is empty or is set to ***default***, then request returns:
`key`
`occurrenceId`
`subject`
`ownerKey`
`eventCategory`
`startDateTime`
`endDateTime`

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

post.description:
Used to create a calendar event in IN-FORM.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2024.00**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

get.description:
Used to get data for specified calendar event.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2023.50**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Identification key of the calendar event.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of fields which need to be returned in response.
When **fields** parameter is set to ***all***, then all available data are returned.
When **fields** parameter is empty or is set to ***default***, then request returns:
`key`
`eventMode`
`subject`
`ownerKey`
`eventCategory`
`startDateTime` (for **eventMode = single**)
`endDateTime` (for **eventMode = single**)
`seriesStartDate` (for **eventMode = serial**)
`seriesEndDate` (for **eventMode = serial**)
`occurrenceStartTime` (for **eventMode = serial**)
`occurrenceEndTime` (for **eventMode = serial**)

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Optional checksum used to prevent overwriting changes made to the resource by other users.
In order to use this mechanism, this header needs to be filled with value returned in **eTag** header of getCalendarEvent response.

Use this request to delete an occurence of a serial calendar event. Serial event occurrences cannot be moved to trash and are always deleted permanently.

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

post.description:
Used to start preparing specified printout.
Returns ID of requested printout, which can be used in getPrintout request to download it.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2023.00**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Name of the company in IN-FORM.

202.description: Order for printout has been accepted and added to the queue.

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

get.description:
Used to get printout state, using ID returned from preparePrintout request.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2023.00**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Name of the company in IN-FORM.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Printout ID returned from preparePrintout request.

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

get.description:
Used to get printout (in PDF format), using ID returned from preparePrintout request.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2023.00**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Name of the company in IN-FORM.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Printout ID returned from preparePrintout request.

parameters.name: startPage
parameters.description: First page to get from printout.

parameters.name: endPage
parameters.description: Last page to get from printout. If value is **0**, then returns printout from `startPage` to the end of printout.

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

This request does not returns attachments as files.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of returned attachments.

parameters.name: phrase
parameters.description: Returns data containing the text.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Type of the resource in IN-FORM, to which the attachment is assigned. This parameter is **required** when **resourceKey** is given.

parameters.name: resourceKey
parameters.description: Key of the resource in IN-FORM, to which the attachment is assigned.

parameters.name: registrationDate.gte
parameters.description: Registration date greater than or equal to the given date in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: registrationDate.lte
parameters.description: Registration date less than or equal to the given date in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: expirationDate.lte
parameters.description: Expiration date less than or equal to the given date in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: contentType

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Results sorting order.
Suffix .**asc** means ascending order, .**desc** means descending order.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of fields which need to be returned in response.
When **fields** parameter is set to ***all***, then all available data are returned.
When **fields** parameter is empty or is set to ***default***, then request returns:
`key`
`fileName`
`description`
`contentType`
`registrationDate`
`expirationDate`

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

get.description:
Used to get attachment file.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2022.50**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Name of the company in IN-FORM.

parameters.name: responseType
parameters.description:
Specifies the response type of the file.
Thumbnail type is available only for pictures. If you request ***thumbnail*** for a file that is not a picture, then request will fail with error.
Flattened PDF type is available only for PDF files. If you request ***flattenedPdf*** for a file that is not a PDF, then request will fail with error.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Identification key of the attachment.

default.description: Error with proper HTTP response status. Details in errorMessage.

get.description:
Used to get the directory structure of attachments in IN-FORM for a resource, that is specified using 'resourceType' and 'resourceKey'.

Minimal IN-FORM version required: **2024.50**.
When this is not met, then error will be returned.
Value of minimal IN-FORM version is available in the parameter: **x-minInformVersion** in openAPI.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Name of the company in IN-FORM.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Type of the resource in IN-FORM, to which the attachment is assigned.

parameters.name: resourceKey
parameters.description: Key of the resource in IN-FORM, to which the attachment is assigned.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Base path from which directory structure should be listed. If not specified, the entire structure will be returned from the root path.

content.description: Content of this calendar event in plaintext format.

startDateTime.description: Date and time of the start of this calendar event in ISO 8601 format. It must be before `endDateTime`.

startDateTimeEnabled.description: Flag that indicates whether this calendar event has the start date-time enabled. At least one of `startDateTimeEnabled` and `endDateTimeEnabled` must be `true`.

endDateTime.description: Date and time of the end of this calendar event in ISO 8601 format. It must be after `startDateTime`.

endDateTimeEnabled.description: Flag that indicates whether this calendar event has the end date-time enabled. At least one of `startDateTimeEnabled` and `endDateTimeEnabled` must be `true`.

remindBeforeStart.description: How long (in seconds) before `startDateTime` a reminder should be activated.

reminderEnabled.description: Flag that indicates if the reminder for this event is enabled.

private.description: Flag that indicates whether this calendar event is marked as private.

wholeDayEvent.description: Flag that indicates whether this calendar event is marked as a whole day event. If `true`, `startDateTime` and `endDateTime` are ignored.

calendarSerialEventSchemaTypeModel.description: Schema type used to generate event occurrences.

regularity.description:
Mode that should be used to determine event occurrences.
When this value is `allBusinessDays` the event will occur on every business day (Monday-Friday).
When this value is `interval` the event will occur every `daysInterval` days.

daysInterval.description:
The period at which the event is to occur.

Example:
`seriesStartDate` is `2022-06-22` and `daysInterval` is 3 - the occurrences of this series will be:
`2022-06-22`
`2022-06-25`
`2022-06-28`
`...`

regularity.description:
Mode that should be used to determine event occurrences.
When this value is `allBusinessDays` the event will occur on every business day (Monday-Friday).
When this value is `interval` the event will occur every `daysInterval` days.

weekdays.description: An array of weekdays on which the event should occur.

weeksInterval.description: The period at which the event is to occur. Example: if this value is 2, then the event will occur every other week.

regularity.description:
Mode that should be used to determine event occurrences.

`interval` mode allows an event to be created which occurs on a certain date every month or few months, for example the 15th.

`specificDay` mode should be used for events that occur on specific days, for example the third Monday of the month.

monthsInterval.description: The period at which the event is to occur. Example: if this value is 2, then the event will occur every other month.

dayOfMonth.description: The number of the day of the month that event should occur on.

regularity.description:
Mode that should be used to determine event occurrences.

`interval` mode allows an event to be created which occurs on a certain date every month or few months, for example the 15th.

`specificDay` mode should be used for events that occur on specific days, for example the third Monday of the month.

monthsInterval.description: The period at which the event is to occur. Example: if this value is 2, then the event will occur every other month.

occurrenceMode.description: Specifies the day when combined with the `specificDay` value. Example: if `occurrenceMode` is `last` and `specificDay` is `monday` then the event will occur on the last monday every `monthsInterval` months.

xPollingIdResponseModel.description: Checksum that can be used in **x-polling-id** header in GET request.

xPollingIdRequestModel.description:
Optional checksum used for the Long Polling mechanism.
To use this mechanism, this header needs to be filled with value returned in **x-polling-id** header of previous response of the same GET request. In this case, the response is sent when the resource changes.
If this header is empty, the response is immediately sent.

xPollingTimeoutRequestModel.description: Maximum timeout in seconds to wait for a resource change. This header can be only used when x-polling-id is specified.

etagResponseModel.description: Checksum that can be used in **if-match** header in PATCH or DELETE request to prevent overwriting changes made by other users.

oAuth2.description:
Authorization in IN-FORM API is oAuth2 password grant flow.
You need an `accessToken` to gain access. It can be obtained by sending a request POST `/token` with the `grantType` set as `password` and user credentials in the body of the request. The response also returns the expiry time of the `accessToken`. It needs to be obtained again after it expires.
Each request marked with `oAuth2` authorization requires adding an `accessToken` to the request header in the form of `Authorization: Bearer `.
Additionally, it is possible to obtain an `accessToken` by sending a request POST `/token` with the `grantType` set as `refreshToken` and `refreshToken` instead of user credentials. This will allow you not to save the users password and will increase security, we recommend using `refreshToken`.
